section.title: Delete your network with nova-network API and cURL
section.para: These sections walk you through deleting your network, or virtual interface, by using cURL.

para.emphasis: Choose one of the following methods:

listitem.para: If you created a network and booted a new server with that network, choose “Delete network (nova-network API/cURL)”
If you created a network, created a virtual interface, and attached the interface to an existing server, choose “Delete virtual interface (nova-network API/cURL)”

step.para: Issue the following command. In the command, specify the ID for the server that you want to delete.

listitem.para: instance_id. The ID of the server instance from which you want to detach the virtual interface.
interface_id. The ID of the virtual interface that you want to delete.

step.para: Successful deletion returns 204 response code as shown in the following output:
step.programlisting: HTTP/1.1 204 No Content Date: Thu, 16 Aug 2012 17:19:53 GMT Content-Length: 0 Content-Type: application/json X-Compute-Request-Id: req-3bdafeb2-d4b1-41c3-ab19-d310f3f270d3 Server: Jetty(8.0.y.z-SNAPSHOT)

step.para: Issue the following cURL command to determine if your virtual interface was deleted:

listitem.para: The ID of the server instance for which you want to list virtual interfaces.

step.para: After the virtual interface is deleted, it no longer appears in the list of virtual interfaces.

note.para: If you have created a virtual interface with your network, you must delete the virtual interface before deleting the network (see “Delete virtual interface (nova-network API/cURL)”).

step.title: Delete the network
step.para:
Issue the following cURL command:
$ curl -i https://dfw.servers.api.rackspacecloud.com/v2/$account/os-networksv2/29f52c7e-6efd-4335-a14a-db77d32a2555 \ -X 'DELETE' \ -H "X-Auth-Token: $token" \ -H "X-Auth-Project-Id: $account" \ -H "Accept: application/json"

note.para: Include the -i option in the cURL command to show the response header. Omit the | python -m json.tool clause from the command because the API operation does not return a JSON response.

listitem.para: The network ID of the network that you want to delete. In this example, The network ID is 29f52c7e-6efd-4335-a14a-db77d32a2555. To determine the network ID, issue a nova network-list command.

step.para: Successful deletion returns an Accepted (202) response code:

screen.computeroutput:
HTTP/1.1 202 Accepted Date: Thu, 04 Oct 2012 16:23:30 GMT Content-Length: 58 Content-Type: text/html;charset=UTF-8 Server: Jetty(8.0.y.z-SNAPSHOT)
202 Accepted
The request is accepted for processing.
